alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 30 at 5:11AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Potential for heavy rainfall between Tuesday night into Thursday... A large scale weather system is expected to impact parts of the Quad State region with moderate to locally heavy rainfall between Tuesday night into Thursday. Nearly all of the moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected just ahead of an Arctic cold front that will slowly work southeast across the region Wednesday into Thursday. From late Tuesday night into Wednesday, the Foothills area of southeast Missouri onward to southwest Illinois could see rainfall amounts of one to one and half inches of rain. From Wednesday night into Thursday, rainfall amounts of one and half to two inches of rain will be possible ahead of the cold front over the remainder of the Quad State region. With soil moisture relatively high for this time of year, it will take less time for rainfall to runoff into ditches, creeks, and streams. The excess runoff could lead to some flooding of low-lying and flood-prone areas Wednesday and Thursday. Stay tuned to later forecasts and statements regarding this evolving weather system this week.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
